column4: haha sara_poo you can just do sudo passwd root to create a root password and use the root account
hey, when you're bored, guessing root passwords randomly can be fun...
i like how you think, dooglus
yeah he needs the O2 for breathing not fire..
why doe ubuntu come with /etc/fstab and /etc/mtab? what's the diff between the two?
/etc/mtab is "what is mounted" and /etc/fstab is "what do I know how to mount"
/etc/fstab stays the same size as you umount stuff, whereas /etc/mtab gets smaller
what is used to automount my USB external?
I don't know.  it's magic.  it just works (for about 10 minutes, after which it just crashes) for me
does pkill do the same as killall
it's laggy for me, and it also seems to cause gnome to hang on startup most of the time (in breezy)
if I use esd, pausing a music track takes a noticeable time, as does restarting playback.  with alsa it's instantanous
